column1: obituary for: dorothy jean claycomb | boone funeral home - a family tradition funeral home| family owned and operated site manager: login home obituaries about us our facilities planning a funeral pre-planning immediate arrangements grief support expressions of sympathy obituaries dorothy jean claycomb (may 27
column3: 2015) send sympathy gifts send sympathy card dorothy jean claycomb
column7: went to be with her lord and savior at 10:18 pm
column10: 2015 at the home of her daughter
column11: surrounded by her family. she was born in evansville on may 27
column13: a daughter to the late oscar and pauline (burton) hughes. after attending bosse high school
column14: dorothy married jerry l. claycomb and together raised 7 children. she was employed by bernardin bottle cap and was a long time member of bethel temple since it was located downtown
column15: attended the r. r. schwambach fellowship class and was involved in the saints alive singers at the church. dorothy loved spending time with her family especially at family gatherings and vacations. she is survived by sons john ( becky)
column19: daughters carla wolf ( darrell) and carrie jarboe ( richard)
column21: 16 grandchildren and 21 great-grandchildren and 1 great-great grandchild. dorothy was preceded in death by her parents
column23: jerry l. claycomb in 2003 and grandson joe chittenden in 1992. funeral services will be held at 10:00 am
column26: 2015 at boone funeral home east chapel-a family tradition funeral home
column28: evansville with reverend steve schwambach officiating. burial will be in oak hill cemetery. friends may call from 3 pm until 7 pm
column31: 2015 at boone funeral home east chapel-a family tradition funeral home. memorial contributions may be made to bethel community church
column36: in 47714 condolences may be made to the family online at boonefuneralhome. net print back express your condolences contact us get mobile version privacy terms of use 2007 - 2015 boone funeral home - a family tradition funeral home funeral home website by batesville
